group_1.narration: I later learned from Tsukuyo that@our mother was from Mizuna Ward.
She also told me that she had been@prohibited from visiting Kosho Ward@by our grandmother.
The fact we were twins had@been concealed from both of us.
We talked and ended up complaining about@each of the families we were raised with,@just one problem after another.

group_1.textRight: It's unbelievable, isn't it?! Cooking,@laundry, cleaning, managing money!
Literally all of the house work!
And even though they make me do all that,@none of them ever thinks to help me?!
He has an important job and it's hard, I@know. And he has to support his students.
But that has nothing to do with this!
All he ever says is, "That's a woman's job!"@I swear, he's stuck in the Stone Age!
And because of him I can never go@anywhere after school with my friends.
Even if I talk about it with others, no one@gets it.
It's okay, though. I know I'm the one who's@weird. I've always known that...
Do you know how it feels?@This...emptiness and pain!

group_1.textLeft: Even our current situations are similar.@We truly are twins in all respects.

group_1.narration: As Tsukuyo listened, nodding kindly, I felt@like she really understood how I felt, @unlike the other kids at school.
I don't know why it was so easy@to open up to her. Maybe it was@because we were twins.

group_1.textLeft: I would love to talk with you again sometime.

group_1.textRight: We don't need to act like we're strangers.

group_1.narration: So in just one day we became friends @and traded numbers so we could meet@up again.
Of course, I was worried that my dad might@find out about us if I put her in my phone@under a real name, so I used an alias.
Identical to our flutes, two become one.
I registered her name in my phone@as a circle, to represent a full moon.
But our friendship wouldn't last@as long as we expected...
And that's why we had to make our wish.

group_1.textCenter: Dad, I wish you'd told me about her...
